revision.text:
[[File:CoA mil ITA rgt alpini 007.png|thumb|right|300px|Coat of Arms of the 7th Alpini Regiment]] [[File:Alpini Btn Feltre - Ex Falzarego 2011 006.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Alpini of the 7th Alpini during the Falzarego 2011 exercise]] [[File:Alpini Btn Feltre - Ex Falzarego 2011 005.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Alpini of the 7th Alpini during the Falzarego 2011 exercise]] [[File:Alpini Btn Feltre - Ex Falzarego 2011 001.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Alpini of the 7th Alpini during the Falzarego 2011 exercise]] The '''7th Alpini Regiment''' ({{lang-it|7° Reggimento Alpini}}) is a [[light Infantry]] [[regiment]] of the [[Italian Army]], specializing in [[mountain warfare|mountain combat]]. The [[Alpini]] are a mountain infantry corps of the Italian Army, that distinguished itself in combat during [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. ==World War I== During World War I the regiment consisted of 10 battalions and saw heavy fighting in the [[Alps]] against [[Austria-Hungary|Austria’s]] [[Kaiserjäger]] and [[German Empire|Germany’s]] [[Alpenkorps (German Empire)|Alpenkorps]]. The battalions of the regiment in these days were (pre-war raised units in bold, followed by their first and second line reserve battalions): * [[File:Nappina bianca.png|15px]] '''Feltre''', ''Val Cismon'', ''Monte Pavione'' * [[File:Nappina rossa.png|15px]] '''Pieve di Cadore''', ''Val Piave'', ''Monte Antelao'' * [[File:Nappina verde.png|15px]] '''Belluno''', ''Val Cordevole'', ''Monte Pelmo'', ''Monte Marmolada'', '' Uork Amba'' ==Current structure== The regiment is part of the [[Alpine Brigade Julia|Alpine Brigade ''Julia'']] and based in the city of [[Belluno]]. * [[File:CoA mil ITA rgt alpini 007.png|30px]] '''Regimental Command''' ** [[File:Nappina blu - Regimental supports.png|18px]] Command and Logistic Support Company ''"La cacao"'' ** [[File:Nappina bianca.png|18px]] '''Alpini Battalion ''[[Feltre]]''''' *** [[File:Nappina bianca.png|15px]] 64th Alpini Company ''"La Crodarola"'' *** [[File:Nappina bianca.png|15px]] 65th Alpini Company ''"La Manilla"'' *** [[File:Nappina bianca.png|15px]] 66th Alpini Company ''"El camors"'' *** [[File:Nappina bianca.png|15px]] 125th Maneuver Support Company ''"La tonante"'' == Equipment == The Alpini companies are equipped with [[Bandvagn 206|Bv 206S]] tracked all-terrain carriers, [[Puma (AFV)|Puma 6x6]] wheeled [[Armoured personnel carrier|armored personnel carriers]] and [[Iveco LMV|Lince]] light multirole vehicles. The maneuver support company company is equipped with [[Mortier 120mm Rayé Tracté Modèle F1|120mm mortars]] and [[Spike (missile)|Spike MR]] [[Anti-tank missile|anti-tank guided missile]]s. ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20101012045700/http://www.esercito.difesa.it/root/unita_sez/unita_ftralp_7.asp Official Homepage]
{{Italy-stub}} {{Mil-unit-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alpini Regiment 07}} [[Category:Alpini regiments of Italy]] [[Category:Regiments of Italy in World War I]] [[Category:Regiments of Italy in World War II]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1887]] [[Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1943]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1953]]

'''Almonda''' is a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] [[village]] of around 300 inhabitants in the civil parish of [[Zibreira]], within the municipality of [[Torres Novas]] and the [[Santarém District]]. The village was named after the river Almonda, whose source is located nearby. [[File:Aroeira3.jpg|thumb|[[Aroeira 3]] skull of a 400,000 year old [[Homo heidelbergensis|Homo Heidelbergensis]]; the oldest trace of human history in [[Portugal]]]] Almonda is noted for the [[Aroeira cave]] (possibly the largest cave in the country) in the [[Karst]] [[limestone]] landscape, where the 400,000 year old [[Aroeira 3]] skull of a [[Homo heidelbergensis|Homo Heidelbergensis]] was discovered in 2014. It is the oldest trace of human history in [[Portugal]].[https://phys.org/news/2017-03-year-old-fossil-human-cranium-oldest.html Phys Org, March 13, 2017, 400,000-year-old fossil human cranium is oldest ever found in Portugal][http://www.pnas.org/content/early/2017/03/07/1619040114.full.pdf?with-ds=yes Joan Daura] [[et al.]]: ''New Middle Pleistocene hominin cranium from Gruta da Aroeira (Portugal).'' In ''[[Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences]] (PNAS)'' Online pre-release of 13 March 2017.[http://www.abendblatt.de/ratgeber/wissen/article209948697/Der-Urmensch-aus-Portugal.html The primitive man from Portugal], Article from 16 March 2017 in [[Hamburger Abendblatt|des Hamburger Abendblatt]], accessed March 22, 2017.[https://www.publico.pt/2017/03/13/ciencia/noticia/cranio-de-400-mil-anos-e-o-fossil-humano-mais-antigo-descoberto-em-portugal-1765063 ''Crânio de 400 mil anos é o fóssil humano mais antigo descoberto em Portugal''] (''English: 400,000 year old skull found; the oldest human fossil in Portugal'') Article from March 13, 2017 in the Portuguese newspaper [[Público (Portugal)|Público]], accessed March 22, 2017. The local conditions of [[Karst|Karstic]] [[limestone]] topography and abundance of water provided the possibility of obtaining energy, and thus, in 1818, Domingos Ardisson established the [[Renova (company)|Renova paper factory]]. The company is an important commercial engine of the [[Torres Novas]] region, and well-known both nationally and internationally. Although the company has expanded, the "old factory" continues to function. ==References== {{reflist}} {{coord|39.5057|N|8.6157|W|display= title}} [[Category:Archaeological sites in Santarém District]] {{Municipalities of Santarém}} [[Category:Villages in Portugal]] [[Category:Municipalities of Portugal]] [[Category:Populated places in Santarém District]] [[Category:Municipalities of Santarém District]] [[Category:Torres Novas| ]] {{Portugal-stub}}

{{Infobox diocese |jurisdiction = Apostolic Vicariate |name = Awasa |latin = Vicariatus Apostolicus Avasanus |country = {{flag|Ethiopia}} |metropolitan = ''Immediately subject to the Holy See'' |rite = [[Latin Rite]] |cathedral = |cocathedral = |area_km2 = 75,000 |population = 5,600,000 |population_as_of = 2004 |catholics = 157,417 |catholics_percent= 2.8 |bishop = Vacant |coadjutor = |auxiliary_bishops= |map = File:Ethiopia - Vicariato apostolico di Awasa.jpg }}
The '''Apostolic Vicariate of Awasa''' ({{lang-la|Vicariatus Apostolicus Avasanus}}) is a [[Roman Catholic]] [[Apostolic Vicariate]] in central [[Ethiopia]].
It is exempt, i.e. directly dependent on the [[Holy See]] (notably the Roman missionary [[Congregation for the Evangelization of Peoples]]), not part of any ecclesiastical province.
Its [[cathedral]] [[episcopal see]] is the [[Kidane Mehret Cathedral, Asmara|Kidane-Meheret Cathedral]] located in the city of [[Awasa]], on the shores of [[Lake Awasa]] in the [[Great Rift Valley]].
The Vicariate of Awasa comprises the following:
Southern Nations and Nationalities Peoples Representatives State (SNNPRSRS):
# Sidama zone # Gedeo zone # Amaaro (special Wereda (District) # Burji (special Wereda (District)
Oromia region:
# Guji zone # Borana Zone
Soamli region:
#Liben Zone
== History == * Established on March 25, 1937 as the '''[[Apostolic Prefecture]] of Neghelli''', on Ethiopian territories split off from the then [[Apostolic Vicariate of Galla]] and [[Apostolic Prefecture of Kaffa]] * On 1940.02.13 it lost territory to establish the then [[Apostolic Prefecture of Hosanna]] * Renamed after its see on October 15, 1969 as the '''Apostolic Prefecture of Awasa''' * Promoted on March 15, 1979 as the '''[[Apostolic Vicariate]] of Awasa''', hence entitled to a [[titular bishop]].
== Ordinaries == (all [[Roman rite]]; so far missionary members of Latin congregations)
;''Apostolic Prefect of Neghelli * Fr. [[Gabriele Arosio]], [[Pontifical Institute for Foreign Missions]] (P.I.M.E.) (May 21, 1937 – death 1945) * [[Urbain-Marie Person]], [[Capuchin Franciscans]] (O.F.M. Cap.) (January 2, 1952 – October 15, 1969 'see below''); ''also [[Apostolic Administrator]] of Harar (below) (1952 – 1955.07.03), Apostolic Administrator of [[Apostolic Vicariate of Gimma]] (Ethiopia) (1952–1958), Apostolic Administrator of [[Apostolic Prefecture of Hosanna]] (Ethiopia) (1952.01.02 – 1972); [[Titular Bishop]] of [[Cyme (Aeolis)|Cyme]] (1955.07.03 – 1994.02.09) & Apostolic Vicar of [[Apostolic Vicariate of Harar|Harar]] (Ethiopia) (1955.07.03 – 1981.12.04)
;''Apostolic Prefects of Awasa (Hawassa / Auasa) * [[Urbain-Marie Person]], [[Capuchin Franciscans]] (O.F.M. Cap.) (''see above'' October 15, 1969 – retired February 16, 1973) * Fr. Armido Gasparini, [[Comboni Missionaries of the Heart of Jesus]] (M.C.C.I.) (February 16, 1973 – March 15, 1979 ''see below'')
;''Apostolics Vicar of Awasa * [[Armido Gasparini]], M.C.C.I. (''see above'' March 15, 1979 – December 20, 1993), Titular Bishop of [[Magnetum]] (1979.03.15 – death 2004.10.21) * Lorenzo Ceresoli, M.C.C.I. (December 20, 1993 – retired March 21, 2009), Titular Bishop of [[Fallaba]] (1993.12.20 – ...) * [[Giovanni Migliorati (bishop)|Giovanni Migliorati]], M.C.C.I. (March 21, 2009 – May 12, 2016), Titular Bishop of [[Ambia (Mauretania)|Ambia]] (2009.03.21 – 2016.05.12)
==References== <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== * [http://www.gcatholic.org/dioceses/diocese/awas0.htm GCatholic.org with incumbent bio links] * [http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/diocese/dawas.html Catholic Hierarchy] [[Wikipedia:Verifiability#Reliable sources|{{sup|{{small|[''self-published'']}}}}]]

{{Infobox company | name = Banjalučka pivara | logo = | type = [[public company|Public]] | foundation = {{start date and age|1873}} | location = [[Banja Luka]], [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]] | key_people = Ragnar A Tryggvason (President of the [[Board of directors|steering board]])
Nicholas Penny ([[Director-general|General director]]) | industry = [[Beverages]] | products = [[Beer]]s and [[lagers]] | revenue = {{increase}} [[Euro|€]]23.40 million | revenue_year = {{small|2016}}{{cite web |title=Finansijski izvještaj za 2016. godinu|url=http://www.banjaluckapivara.com/srp/images/download/finansijski/fin2016/BLPV%20Godisnji%20FI%202016%2028.02.2017.xlsx |website=banjaluckapivara.com |date=27 February 2017 |accessdate=16 October 2018 |language=Serbian}} | operating_income = | income_year = | net_income = {{decrease}} €3.13 million | net_income_year = {{small|2016}} | aum = | assets = {{increase}} €26.43 million | assets_year = {{small|2016}} | equity = {{increase}} €17.79 million | equity_year = {{small|2016}} | owner = | members = | members_year = | num_employees = | num_employees_year = | homepage = {{url|http://www.banjaluckapivara.com}} }} '''Banjalučka Pivara''' or '''Banja Luka Brewery''', is a Bosnian [[brewing]] company based in [[Banja Luka]], [[Republika Srpska]]. The company was founded as part of activities by the [[Mariastern Abbey, Banja Luka|Trappist order]] in the village of Delibaša. After [[World War II]] the brewery was nationalized and in 1975 included in newly founded company "Bosanska Krajina". ==Brands== [[File:Pivo Nektar, BiH.JPG|thumb|200px|''Nektar'' - beer from Banja Luka]] *''Nektar Pivo'', original beer *''Nektar Limun'', [[shandy]] with flavour of lemon *''Nektar Grejp'', shandy with flavour of grapefruit *''Nektar Ananas'', shandy with flavour of pineapple *''Nektar Ribizla'', shandy with flavour of currant *''Nektar Crveni Grejp'', shandy with flavour of red grapefruit *''Nektar Special'', ale beer *''Kaltenberg pivo'', royal Bavaria beer *''Crni Đorđe pivo'', dark beer named after [[Karađorđe]] *''Kastel pivo'' ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.banjaluckapivara.com}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Banjalucka Pivara}} [[Category:Beer in Bosnia and Herzegovina]] [[Category:Companies based in Banja Luka]] [[Category:Companies established in 1873]] [[Category:Brands of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] {{Beer-stub}} {{BosniaHerzegovina-stub}}

{{italicstitle}} '''''Bondia''''' ({{IPA-ca|ˌbɔnˈdi.ə}}) is a newspaper published in [[Catalan language|Catalan]]. It is published in two editions:
*Principality of [[Andorra]] *[[Lleida]], [[Catalonia]], [[Spain]]
The publisher is Group Bondia. It launched the newspaper in a free Andorran edition in Catalan. In 2006 it started publishing another edition in Lleida, Catalonia with a run of 15,000.
==External links== *[http://www.bondia.ad/ ''Bondia Andorra'' edition website] *[http://www.bondia.cat/ ''Bondia Lleida'' edition website] *[http://www.gangues-andorra.com/ Anuncis Andorra]

revision.text:
The '''Cabo Verdean diaspora''' refers to both historical and present [[emigration]] from [[Cape Verde]]. Today, more Cabo Verdeans live abroad than in Cape Verde itself. The country with the largest number of Cape Verdeans living abroad is the [[United States]].
==Notable people of Cabo Verdean descent== [[Image:Horace Silver by Dmitri Savitski 1989.jpg|thumb|Horace Silver, a legendary jazz pianist and composer, is of Cape Verdean descent]]
*[[Michael Beach]] - American actor of Cabo Verdean descent *[[Blu Cantrell]] - singer *[[José Ramos Delgado]] - football player *[[Peter Gomes]] - American preacher and theologian *[[Ryan Gomes]] - former basketball player for the [[Boston Celtics]], now playing for the [[Minnesota Timberwolves]] *[[Tony Gonzalez]] - player for the [[Atlanta Falcons]] *[[Henrik Larsson]] - former football player for [[Celtic F.C.]], [[FC Barcelona]], [[Manchester United]] and [[Helsingborgs IF]] *[[George N. Leighton]] - retired American judge *[[Dave Leitao]] - basketball coach at [[DePaul University]] *[[Lura (singer)]] - Born in Portugal to parents from the Cape Verde islands *[[Davey Lopes]] - former Major League Baseball second baseman and manager *[[Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes]] - singer and rapper from the group [[TLC (band)|TLC]] *[[Nani]] - [[Valencia_CF|Valencia C.F.]] (football) winger *[[Paul Pena]] - singer, songwriter, guitarist, and subject of the documentary [[Genghis Blues]] *[[Amber Rose]] - model, recording artist, actress and socialite *[[Horace Silver]] - legendary jazz pianist and composer *[[Patrick Vieira]] - football (soccer) player whose career has involved spells at French, Italian, UK and US clubs *[[Nancy Vieira]] - singer based in Lisbon {{clear}}
==International communities== ===Africa=== * [[Cape Verdean Angolan]] * [[Cape Verdean Gabonese]] * [[Cape Verdean Guinea-Bissauan]] * [[Cape Verdean Ivorian]] * [[Cape Verdean Mozambican]] * [[Cape Verdean Sao Tomese]] * [[Cape Verdeans in Senegal]]
===Europe=== * [[Cape Verdeans in the Netherlands]] * [[Cape Verdean French]] * [[Cape Verdean German]] * [[Cape Verdeans in Italy]] * [[Cape Verdean Luxembourger]] * [[Cape Verdeans in Portugal]] * [[Cape Verdean Spanish]] * [[Cape Verdean Swedish]]
===North America=== * [[Cape Verdean American]] * [[Cape Verdean Canadian]] * [[Cape Verdean Cuban]]
===South America=== * [[Cape Verdean Argentines]]
== See also == * [[History of Cape Verde]] * [[List of Cape Verdeans]] * [[:Category:People of Cape Verdean descent]]

{{Infobox Treaty | name = Cape Verde – Mauritania Maritime Delimitation Treaty | long_name = Treaty on the Delimitation of the Maritime Frontier between the Islamic Republic of Mauritania and the Republic of Cape Verde | image = EEZ Cape Verde.png | image_width = | caption = Maritime boundaries of Cape Verde, Mauritania, and neighboring countries. | type = [[boundary delimitation]] | date_drafted = | date_signed = 19 September 2003 | location_signed = [[Praia]], [[Cape Verde]] | date_sealed = | date_effective = | condition_effective = | date_expiration = | signatories = | parties = {{flag|Cape Verde}}
{{flag|Mauritania}} | ratifiers = | depositor = {{flagicon|United Nations}} [[United Nations Secretariat]] | language = | languages = Arabic; French; Portuguese | wikisource = }} The '''Cape Verde – Mauritania Maritime Delimitation Treaty''' is a [[treaty]] between [[Cape Verde]] and [[Mauritania]] in which the two states agreed to the [[Boundary delimitation|delimitation]] of their [[maritime boundary]].{{cite book|author=[[Jonathan Charney|Charney, Jonathan I.]], Colson, David A., Alexander, Lewis M., Smith, Robert W. |url={{Google books|RN0GnOcw0McC|page=3694|plainurl=yes}}|year=2005|title=International Maritime Boundaries|volume=5|page=3694-3707|isbn=9789004144613|oclc=23254092|publisher=[[Martinus Nijhoff Publishers]]}} The treaty was signed at [[Praia]] on 19 September 2003 and was ratified by Cape Verde on 23 April 2004. The [[border|boundary]] is approximately {{convert|160|nmi|lk=in}} long and trends north–south; the treaty defines it in explicit [[ocean|maritime]] segments using 18 specific points. The official name for the treaty is ''Treaty on the Delimitation of the Maritime Frontier between the Islamic Republic of Mauritania and the Republic of Cape Verde''. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.un.org/Depts/los/LEGISLATIONANDTREATIES/PDFFILES/TREATIES/CPV_MRT2003MB.pdf Full text of treaty] {{DEFAULTSORT:Cape Verde-Mauritania Maritime Delimitation Treaty}} [[Category:2003 in Cape Verde]] [[Category:2003 in Mauritania]] [[Category:Borders of Cape Verde]] [[Category:Borders of Mauritania]] [[Category:Boundary treaties]] [[Category:Treaties of Cape Verde]] [[Category:Treaties of Mauritania]] [[Category:Treaties concluded in 2003]] [[Category:United Nations treaties]] {{CapeVerde-stub}} {{Mauritania-gov-stub}}

{{Infobox organization |name = Census of Antarctic Marine Life |image = |image_border = |size = |alt = |caption = |abbreviation = CAML |formation = {{Start date|2005}} |extinction = |type = Biological census |status = |purpose = |headquarters = [[Australian Antarctic Division]] |region_served = [[Antarctica]] |leader_title = |leader_name = |parent_organization = [[Census of Marine Life]] |budget = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |website = {{URL|www.caml.aq}} }}
The '''Census of Antarctic Marine Life''' (CAML) is a field project of the [[Census of Marine Life]] that researches the marine biodiversity of Antarctica, how it is affected by climate change, and how this change is altering the ecosystem of the Southern Ocean.<ref>[http://www.scar.org/researchgroups/lifescience/CAML_Annual_Report_09.pdf CAML Annual report 2009] published by the [[Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research]]</ref><ref>[http://coml.org/projects/census-antarctic-marine-life-caml Program Description on CoML Website]</ref>
The program started in 2005 as a 5-year initiative with the scientific goal being to study the evolution of life in Antarctic waters, to determine how this has influenced the diversity of the present [[biota (ecology)|biota]], and use these observations to predict how it might respond to future change. However, due to modern and extravagant changes within technology, we are able to witness and influence biodiversity reproduction and development. This enables us to gain further insight toward characteristics that allow such biodiversity to flourish within this barren desert referred to as the Arctic and Antarctic.
CAML has collected its data from 18 Antarctic research vessels during the [[International Polar Year]], which is freely accessible at [http://www.scarmarbin.be Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research Marine Biodiversity Information Network] (SCAR-MarBIN). The [http://www.scarmarbin.be/scarramsabout.php Register of Antarctic Marine Species] has 9,350 verified [[species]] (16,500 taxa) in 17 phyla, from [[microbes]] to [[whales]]. For 1500 species the [[DNA barcode]] is available.
The information from CAML is a robust baseline against which future change may be measured.<ref>[http://www.scar.org/treaty/atcmxxxiii/ATCM33_ip047_e.pdf Agenda Item] [[Antarctic Treaty]] Consultative Meeting 2010</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *{{official|http://www.caml.aq}} *[http://www.antarctica.gov.au/media/news/2010/decade-of-discovery-the-census-of-antarctic-marine-life Australian Antarctic Division media release] *[http://www.scarmarbin.be SCAR-MarBIN] *[http://www.scarmarbin.be/scarramsabout.php Register of Antarctic Marine Species] *[http://www.scar.org Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research]

revision.text:
{{Politics of Republika Srpska}} The '''Constitution of Republika Srpska''' ({{lang-hs|Устав Републике Српске /Ustav Republike Srpske}}) is the chief legal act of [[Republika Srpska]], an entity within [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. The constitution was delivered by the [[National Assembly of Republika Srpska]] on 28 February 1992,<ref name="Ustavni sud">[http://www.ustavnisud.org/Default.aspx?lang=bos Constitutional Court] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140131014544/http://www.ustavnisud.org/Default.aspx?lang=bos |date=2014-01-31 }} official website, retrieved 17-5-2012</ref> but had to be revised after the [[Dayton Agreement]] was signed. It provides the set of laws and principles for the territory, and among its finest functions, it defines the internal organization of the Republic, the function of the official institutions, and the rights and freedoms for its citizens.
The [[Constitutional Court of Republika Srpska]] started its functions on 1 July 1994 and its primary role is to ensure the protection of the Constitution and the law. It is formed by nine judges, including the President, elected in accordance to the Constitution and law.<ref name="Ustavni sud"/>
==History== The constitution of the Bosnian Serb Assembly was formally approved on 28 February 1992 under the designation of the '''Constitution of the Serb Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina''' ({{lang|sr|Устав Српске Републике Босне и Херцеговине/Ustav Srpske Republike Bosne i Hercegovine}}). It was in effect during the [[Bosnian War]] (1992–95), and after the signing of the [[Dayton Agreement]] it underwent numerous modifications in form of amendments in order to comply with the peace agreement and with the [[Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina]].
==Constitution== It is formed by 12 chapters.
I - Basic provisions
II - Human Rights and Freedoms
III - Economic and Social Planning
IV - Rights and duties
V - Organization of Republika Srpska
VI - Territorial Organization
VII - Defense
VIII - The constitutionality and legality
IX - The Constitutional Court
X - Courts and Public Prosecution
XI - Changing the Constitution
XII - Final provisions
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.advokat-prnjavorac.com/legislation/Constitution-of-Republika-Srpska.pdf The Constitution of Republika Srpska] official document {{en icon}} * [http://www.advokat-prnjavorac.com/lawoffice/index-4.html Relevant laws of Republika Srpska] {{en icon}}
{{Republika Srpska}} {{Constitution of Europe}}
[[Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina law]] [[Category:Republika Srpska]]

{{Infobox military structure |name = Devil's Tower Camp |native_name = |partof = |location = [[Devil's Tower Road]], [[Gibraltar]] |image = Devils Tower Camp, Gibraltar.jpg |caption = Devil's Tower Camp |image2 = |caption2 = 1727 plan of Devil's Tower and Mill Tower. |map_type = Gibraltar |coordinates = {{coord|36.14877|-5.34174|type:landmark_region:GI|display=inline}} |map_size = |map_alt = |map_caption = Original location of Devil's Tower within [[Gibraltar]]. |type = [[Barracks]] |code = |builder = |materials = |height = |demolished = |condition = |open_to_public = |controlledby = |current_commander = |commanders = |battles = |events = |ownership = [[File:Flag of Gibraltar.svg|23px]] Government of Gibraltar |operator = |built = 1942 |used=1942-Present |architect = |built_for = [[War Office]] |garrison = |occupants = [[Royal Gibraltar Regiment]] }} '''Devil's Tower Camp''' is a military installation located just south-east of [[Gibraltar International Airport]] on the [[isthmus]] between [[Spain]] and [[Gibraltar]].
==History== The site dates back to 1713 when Spain ceded land to the United Kingdom under the [[Treaty of Utrecht]].<ref name=strange>{{cite web|url=http://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/design/g152/strangest-military-bases-gallery/?slide=7|title=The World's 18 Strangest Military Bases|publisher=Popular Mechanics|accessdate=27 September 2015}}</ref> The camp was established in 1942 as an RAF barracks to support [[RAF Gibraltar]] during the [[World War II|Second World War]] and was located conveniently close to the airfield.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.londonscottishregt.org/assets/files/gazzette/lsrgazzette_autumn03.pdf|title=Pipes and Drums|publisher=London Scottish Regimental Gazette|year=2003|page=73|accessdate=27 September 2015}}</ref>
The facilities, which were increasingly used by the [[British Army]] after the War, became the home of the [[Royal Gibraltar Regiment]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.panorama.gi/localnews/headlines.php?action=view_article&article=10972&offset=0|title=Trip down Rock memory lane for Royal Green Jackets|publisher=Panorama|date=22 October 2013|accessdate=27 September 2015}}</ref> They were expanded and refurbished to provide a new catering complex and single living accommodation for some 450 troops in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ramboll.co.uk/projects/ruk/single%20living%20accommodation%20%20devils%20tower%20camp|title=Single living accommodation, Devil's Tower Camp|publisher=Ramboll|accessdate=27 September 2015}}</ref> The new facilities also included the ''Princess Royal Medical Centre'', established to provide medical facilities for military personnel, which was opened by the [[Anne, Princess Royal|Princess Royal]] during that year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.raf.mod.uk/news/archive.cfm?storyid=DB94436E-1143-EC82-2EB99BBC8B2288C0|title=Princess Royal opens ‘Her’ Medical Centre|date=5 March 2009|accessdate=27 September 2015}}</ref>
In 2011 Government of Gibraltar and the UK [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Defence]] agreed that the UK's property requirements would be filled by the Naval Base, the Airfield, Devil's Tower Camp and Four Corners so releasing extensive other property for disposal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://costatimes.blogspot.co.uk/2011/08/gibraltar-government-has-unveiled.html|title=Gibraltar Government has unveiled a dramatic portfolio of residential and other property that passes it to it following an agreement with the Ministry of Defence|publisher=Costa Times|date=1 August 2011|accessdate=27 September 2015}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox currency | currency_name_in_local = {{native name|fr|syli guinéen}} | image_1 = GUIN1-s-2.png | image_title_1 = 2 sylis coin of 1971 | iso_code = GNS | using_countries = [[Guinea]] | inflation_rate = | inflation_source_date = | subunit_ratio_1 = 1/100 | subunit_name_1 = [[cauri]] | symbol = | used_coins = 50 cauris, 1, 2, 5 sylis | used_banknotes = 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50, 100, 500 sylis | issuing_authority = [[Central Bank of the Republic of Guinea]] | issuing_authority_website = {{URL|http://www.bcrg-guinee.org/}} | obsolete_notice = Y }} The '''syli''' was the currency of [[Guinea]] between 1971 and 1985. It was subdivided into 100 cauris. The word ''syli'' means "elephant", while ''[[Cowry|cauri]]'' refers to the [[Cypraea moneta|shells]] formerly [[Shell money|used as currency]]. The syli replaced the [[Guinean franc]] at a rate of 1 syli = 10 francs.
Coins of 50 cauris, 1, 2 and 5 sylis were made of [[aluminium]]. Banknotes of the 1971 series were issued in denominations of 10, 25, 50 and 100 sylis. A second series of banknotes was issued in 1980, this time in different colours and with four additional denominations – 1, 2, 5 and 500 sylis notes.
The syli was replaced by the [[Guinean franc]] in 1985 at par.

The '''High Anti-Corruption Court of Ukraine''' ({{lang-uk|Вищий антикорупційний суд України}}) is to be established before the end of 2018.[https://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/512072.html Poroshenko submits bill on creating Anti-Corruption Court to High Judicial Council], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (14 June 2018)
{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2018/06/13/7183211/ Anticorruption court launched. The CPC claims to be "substituting" the appeal], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (13 June 2018)
[https://www.unian.info/m/politics/10144694-ukraine-s-parliament-eventually-passes-law-on-anti-corruption-court.html Ukraine's parliament eventually passes law on anti-corruption court], [[UNIAN]] (7 June 2018)
[https://www.unian.info/m/politics/10161143-ukraine-s-rada-adopts-bill-on-establishing-high-anti-corruption-court.html Ukraine's Rada adopts bill on establishing High Anti-Corruption Court], [[UNIAN]] (21 June 2018) Cases concerning [[corruption in Ukraine]] will be bought directly to this court. The jurisdiction of the court covers crimes that caused damage wearth at least [[USD]] 31 thousand.[https://112.international/ukraine-top-news/the-parliament-of-ukraine-adopted-a-law-on-supreme-anti-corruption-court-29169.html Ukrainian Parliament adopts Law on Supreme Anti-Corruption Court], [[112 Ukraine]] (7 June 2018) Appeals will be considered by a completely separate Appeal Chamber of the High Anti-Corruption Court.{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2018/06/7/7182654/ Closed vertical. What is the Higher Anti-Corruption Court and why its creation is afraid of politics?], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (7 June 2018) ==Structure== The court will have 35 judges appointed and at least 10 of them appointed to the Appeals Chamber. These judges and persons living with them, spouses, parents, brothers and sisters, grandparents, spouse’s parents, grandchildren, adopted children and foster parents shall have 24/7 protection. The judges will be elected by the ''High Judicial Qualifications Commission'' with the help of the ''Public Council of International Experts'' (a new body of six people that may consist of foreigners and Ukrainians). ==History== In December 2016 then [[Ministry of Justice (Ukraine)|Minister of Justice]] [[Pavlo Petrenko]] said that a relevant bill for creating a special anti-corruption court was ready to be sent to the [[Ukrainian parliament]]. Parliament saw the draft in December 2017.[https://www.unian.info/m/politics/10133912-urgent-anti-corruption-efforts-in-ukraine.html "Urgent" anti-corruption efforts in Ukraine], [[UNIAN]] (29 May 2018) Parliament adopted the final version of this law on 7 June 2018. The law on the High Anti-Corruption Court of Ukraine came into force on 14 June 2018.[https://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/511967.html Law on High Anti-Corruption Court comes into force], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (14 June 2018) [[Ukrainian President]] [[Petro Poroshenko]] signed the law "On the establishment of the High Anti-Corruption Court" on 26 June 2018.[https://www.unian.info/m/politics/10165775-poroshenko-signs-law-on-establishing-high-anti-corruption-court.html Poroshenko signs law on establishing High Anti-Corruption Court], [[UNIAN]] (26 June 2018) The law had undergone about 2,000 amendments during its passage. The [[International Monetary Fund]] will have to assess if it is sufficient to meet its anti-corruption requirements to release the next tranche of money under its $17.5 billion cash-for-reforms agreement.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-danylyuk/ukraines-sacked-finance-minister-says-no-will-in-cabinet-for-gas-price-hike-idUSKCN1J4288 |title=Ukraine's sacked finance minister says no will in cabinet for gas price hike |last=Williams |first=Matthias |publisher=Reuters |date=8 June 2018 |accessdate=12 August 2018}} ==See also== *[[Corruption in Ukraine]] *[[National Anti-Corruption Bureau of Ukraine]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{ukraine-stub}} {{law-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:High Anti-Corruption Court of Ukraine}} [[Category:2018 establishments in Ukraine]] [[Category:Judicial system of Ukraine]] [[Category:Corruption in Ukraine]]

[[File:Lazaruvane Bov.JPG|thumbnail|Lazaruvane]] '''Lazarice''' ({{lang-sr|лазарице}}), also known by its Bulgarian name '''Lazaruvane''' ({{lang-bg|лазаруване}}), is a traditional procession during the [[Serbian Orthodox]] feast of [[Lazareva Subota]] (corresponding to, but distinct from ''[[Lazarus Saturday]]'' in other [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Orthodox churches]]), the day before [[Palm Sunday]]. Traditionally, a girl who has never participated in the ritual may not marry or be engaged.
The ritual is performed by young girls (typically of age 16 who are unmarried), called '''lazarki''' ({{lang-bg|лазарки}}). The girls decorate their hair richly and colourfully (usually with flower and ribbon wreaths) and dance around the village singing songs. They stop from house to house, performing songs and blessing the homes, accepting small presents and food from the hosts, typically the men. They meet by a river, where they drop their wreaths. It is said that the girl whose laurel first takes the lead will be married first.
Traditionally the groups of lazarki would number around 14, but there are regional variances. It is no longer widely practiced in the large cities where many people live, and tends to be kept alive in the smaller villages - at least those which have young girls.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.euscoop.com/en/2018/3/31/what-is-lazaruvane-bulgaria|title=How Bulgarians Celebrate Lazarus Saturday - Lazarovden|access-date=2018-03-31|language=en}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}} {{commons category|Lazareva Subota}} * ''Ђорђевић Д.'' Живот и обичаjи народни у Лесковачкоj Морави. — Београд, 1958. * ''Каменова А.'' Пролетни обичаи от Чипровци // Българска етнография. Българска етнология. — София, 1992. — № 4. — С. 40-46. * ''Маринов Д.'' Народна вяра и религиозни народни обичаи. — София, 1914.

revision.text:
The '''Serbian National Renewal''' ({{lang-sr|Српска народна обнова, СНО / Srpska narodna obnova, '''SNO'''}}) was the first political party founded in [[Serbia]] after the collapse of [[communism]]. It was established on January 6, 1990 by [[Mirko Jović]] and [[Vuk Drašković]]. Drašković left the party soon after and formed the [[Serbian Renewal Movement]]. [[Vojislav Šešelj]] went on to form the [[Serbian Radical Party]]. The SNO faded into obscurity not long after.
The party has been linked to the Dušan Silni [[paramilitary]] group and some of its members have been found guilty of war crimes related to the [[Lovas massacre]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://arhiva.kurir-info.rs/Arhiva/2007/maj/31/V-03-31052007.shtml|title=Istraga|language=Serbian|publisher=Kurir|date=31 May 2007}}</ref>
{{Serbia-stub}}
==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Nationalist parties in Serbia]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1990]] [[Category:1990 establishments in Serbia]] [[Category:Defunct political parties in Serbia]] [[Category:Serb nationalist parties]]

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=May 2017}} {{Infobox company | name = Softex-Athenian paper mills S.A. | logo = Softex sign.png | type = [[private companies|Private]] | company_slogan = | foundation = 1936 | defunct = 2016 | location = [[Athens]]
[[Greece]] | key_people = Konstantinos Kefalas | num_employees = {{Decrease}} 1.275 (2013) | industry = | products = [[Paper]] [[towel]]s | revenue = {{Increase}} 49.290.000 euros (2013) | homepage = | }} '''Softex S.A.''' is a [[Greece|Greek]] [[paper towel]] company, headquartered in [[Athens]] in the [[Athens Industrial Area]] west of downtown. The company is located at the Acteon Building in Irinis Street, Neo Faliro, Athina. The first owner of the company was [[Apostolos Nikolaidis (athlete)|Apostolos Nikolaidis]]. It manufactures paper towels and napkins and is an affiliate company of [[Bolton Group]], The Netherlands. Softex suffered a fire in August 1994 that destroyed its machines, building and shipping centre. The company operated from other premises until the factory was rebuilt with fireproof technology. ==See also== *[[List of companies in Greece]] ==External links== * [http://www.boltongroup.net Bolton Group webpage] [[Category:Manufacturing companies based in Athens]] [[Category:Pulp and paper companies]] {{Greece-stub}} {{Europe-company-stub}}

Us |publisher = The Cloud}} It has over 22,000 Wi-Fi hotspots [[network access point]]s in the UK.{{cite web |url = http://www.thecloud.net/wifi/news/%E2%80%9Cwhen-in-roam!%E2%80%9D-%E2%80%93-the-cloud-reveals-%E2%80%98state-of-a-wifi-nation%E2%80%99-trends/ |title = When in Roam |publisher = The Cloud}} The Cloud has offices in [[St Albans]], [[Munich]], and [[Stockholm]]. == Timeline == {| class="wikitable" |- !width="100" | Year || Event |- | Jan 2003 || The Cloud is founded |- | Mar 2003 || The Cloud's
